title: Cultivating Courage
devotional:
Eliza had always been a creature of habit. Every morning, the same routine: coffee, Bible reading, and a walk through her garden. Her garden, usually a vibrant tapestry of colors, was beginning to show signs of autumn's approach – the leaves were tinged with yellow and red, and a few had already fallen, creating a crunchy carpet underfoot. One particular morning, a fierce wind was howling, threatening to uproot her prized rose bushes. Fear gripped her. These roses represented years of careful cultivation, a symbol of her resilience after a difficult season of loss.

As she stood there, battling the wind and trying to protect her roses, she felt a familiar wave of anxiety wash over her. What if she couldn't save them? What if the storm destroyed everything she had worked so hard to create? Doubt whispered in her ear, reminding her of past failures and disappointments. But then, she remembered the verse she had read earlier that morning: 'Be strong and courageous. Do not be afraid or terrified because of them, for the Lord your God goes with you; he will never leave you nor forsake you.' (Deuteronomy 31:6)

The words resonated deeply within her. It wasn't just about saving her roses; it was about facing her fears, trusting in God's presence, and choosing courage over despair. Taking a deep breath, she started securing the roses with stakes and twine, working diligently despite the wind's relentless assault. It wasn't easy, and there were moments when she felt like giving up, but she held onto that verse, clinging to the promise of God's unwavering support.

Later that day, the storm subsided, and Eliza surveyed her garden. A few leaves were scattered, and some petals were torn, but the roses stood tall, their vibrant colors undimmed. She had faced her fear, trusted in God's strength, and emerged victorious. It was a powerful reminder that courage isn't the absence of fear, but the willingness to act despite it, knowing that God is always with us, guiding and protecting us, even in the midst of life's fiercest storms.
image_description: A rose bush in a garden, secured with twine, with colorful autumn leaves scattered around the base. A gentle breeze rustles the leaves.
insights: Deuteronomy 31:6, quoted in the devotional, is a cornerstone of courage in the face of adversity. Joshua 1:9 reiterates this command: 'Have I not commanded you? Be strong and courageous. Do not be afraid; do not be discouraged, for the Lord your God will be with you wherever you go.' This promise of God's constant presence is the foundation upon which we can build our courage. Furthermore, Paul encourages us in Philippians 4:13, stating, 'I can do all things through Christ who strengthens me,' reinforcing the idea that our strength comes not from ourselves but from a divine source.
prayer: Heavenly Father, thank you for your promise to never leave me nor forsake me. I confess that I often struggle with fear and anxiety, especially when facing challenges and uncertainties. Grant me the courage to trust in your presence and to act despite my fears. Fill me with your strength and wisdom, and help me to remember that I can do all things through Christ who strengthens me. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: What fears are you currently facing in your life? How can you apply the principle of trusting in God's presence to overcome those fears? What small step can you take today to act with courage, even if you don't feel brave?
